title: Epic 2: Client & Dog Management
description: Full CRUD for clients and dogs with Vue frontend pages. Includes search/filter, tabbed detail views, and photo upload for dog profiles.

title: Create ClientsController with Inertia responses
description:
Implement ClientsController with full CRUD using Inertia responses:
- **index**: Accept params `q` (name/email search), `sort` (name, created_at), `order` (asc/desc). Paginate with pagy gem
- **show**: Include associated dogs, recent appointments, outstanding invoices via props
- **new/create**: Standard form handling with Inertia redirect on success
- **edit/update**: In-place updates with validation errors via Inertia
- **destroy**: Soft delete using `discarded_at` column. Return to index with success flash

NOTE: Add `discarded_at` timestamp column to clients table (create migration if not present). Consider using the `discard` gem for soft delete functionality.

title: Create Vue pages for clients management
Create DogsController nested under clients
description:
Implement DogsController with shallow nesting under clients.

**Routes configuration:**
```ruby
resources :clients do
  resources :dogs, shallow: true, only: [:new, :create]
end
resources :dogs, only: [:show, :edit, :update, :destroy]
```

**Actions:**
- **create**: Nested under client, automatically associates dog
- **show**: Display full profile with temperament, medical notes, linked report cards
- **update**: Support photo upload (prepare attachment, actual storage config in Epic 6)

**Dog attributes:** name, breed, date_of_birth, weight, temperament, medical_notes, spayed_neutered, vaccination_status

Photo upload uses Active Storage `has_one_attached :photo` - storage service will be configured in Epic 6 (Media Management).

title: Create Vue pages for dog profiles
description: Create pages/dogs/: show.vue (profile with photo, temperament, medical notes, report card history), edit.vue (form with photo upload). Include DogCard.vue and DogSelector.vue components.

title: Epic 9: Notifications, Real-time & Polish
description: ActionMailer for appointment reminders, ActionCable for live calendar updates, navigation updates, and mobile optimization.

title: Create AppointmentMailer for confirmations and reminders
description: Build app/mailers/appointment_mailer.rb with methods: confirmation, reminder, cancellation. Include appointment details, client/dog info. Design responsive email templates.

title: Create SendReminderJob for scheduled notifications
description:
Build `app/jobs/send_reminder_job.rb` with Solid Queue scheduling.

**Scheduler configuration** (`config/recurring.yml`):
```yaml
check_upcoming_reminders:
  class: CheckUpcomingRemindersJob
  schedule: every 15 minutes
```

**Flow:**
1. `CheckUpcomingRemindersJob` runs every 15 min
2. Finds appointments where `starts_at` is 24h ± 15min OR 1h ± 15min away
3. Checks `reminder_sent_at` column to prevent duplicate sends
4. Enqueues `SendReminderJob` for each (updates `reminder_sent_at` on send)
5. `SendReminderJob` calls `AppointmentMailer.reminder(...).deliver_later`

**Timezone handling:**
- Store client timezone preference in `clients.timezone` column (or use business timezone)
- Calculate reminder times in the appropriate timezone
- Display local time in email content

Add `reminder_sent_at` timestamp column to appointments table if not present.

title: Create AppointmentsChannel for real-time calendar updates
description: Build app/channels/appointments_channel.rb for ActionCable. Stream appointment changes to calendar. Implement frontend subscription in AppointmentCalendar.vue. Show toast on updates.

title: Update navigation sidebar with new routes
description:
Update `AppLayout.vue` sidebar navigation with all application routes:

**Navigation items:**
- Clients (lucide: Users icon)
- Schedule (lucide: Calendar icon)  
- Invoices (lucide: Receipt icon)
- Report Cards (lucide: ClipboardCheck icon)
- Marketing (lucide: Megaphone icon)

**Implementation:**
- Use existing shadcn sidebar pattern
- Highlight active route using vue-router
- Ensure responsive collapse on mobile
- Group related items logically

This is a focused task - TypeScript interfaces and mobile polish are separate tasks.

title: Add TypeScript interfaces for all domain entities
description:
Add/update TypeScript interfaces in `app/frontend/types/index.d.ts` for all domain entities:

**Required interfaces:**
- Client (id, name, email, phone, address, notes, dogs_count, created_at)
- Dog (id, client_id, name, breed, date_of_birth, weight, temperament, medical_notes)
- ServiceType (id, name, duration_minutes, base_price, max_capacity, is_group)
- Appointment (id, client_id, dog_id, service_type_id, starts_at, ends_at, status, notes)
- Enrollment (id, appointment_id, dog_id, status, waitlist_position)
- Invoice (id, client_id, status, due_date, total_amount, line_items)
- InvoiceLineItem (id, invoice_id, description, quantity, unit_price, amount)
- SessionMedia (id, appointment_id, dog_id, media_type, caption, is_featured)
- ReportCard (id, appointment_id, dog_id, scores, notes, status, share_token)
- MediaConsent (id, client_id, marketing_allowed, internal_only)
- MarketingContent (id, title, caption, platform, status, scheduled_at)

Follow existing patterns in the file. Use `id: number` for all primary keys, ISO strings for dates.

title: Mobile responsiveness audit and polish
description:
Audit and fix mobile responsiveness across all pages.

**Testing requirements:**
- Test all pages on mobile viewport (375px width)
- Test on tablet viewport (768px width)

**Common fixes to look for:**
- Fix any horizontal overflow/scrolling issues
- Ensure touch targets are ≥44px for accessibility
- Fix text truncation issues
- Ensure modals/dialogs work on mobile

**PWA updates:**
- Update manifest.json name to "Sit Stay"
- Update short_name to "SitStay"
- Ensure appropriate icons are set

**Pages to test:**
- Clients list/show
- Schedule/calendar (may need special mobile view)
- Invoices list/show
- Report cards
- Marketing content

This task should be done near the end after all features are implemented.

title: Epic 7: Progress Report Cards
description: Report card system with score visualization (rings/gauges), media montage generation, and shareable public links via signed tokens.

title: Create ReportCardsController with shareable links
description:
Implement ReportCardsController with authenticated and public (shareable) routes.

**Routes:**
```ruby
resources :report_cards
get "/p/:token", to: "report_cards#public_show", as: :public_report_card
```

**Token generation** (add to ReportCard model):
```ruby
generates_token_for :share, expires_in: 30.days

# Generate: report_card.generate_token_for(:share)
# Find: ReportCard.find_by_token_for(:share, params[:token])
```

**Actions:**
- Standard CRUD (authenticated)
- `public_show`: Find by token, render without requiring login, track view count

**Security:** Public view should NOT expose client email/phone—only dog name, scores, and media. Consider adding `view_count` column to track shares.

title: Create report card Vue pages with score visualization
description: Create pages/report_cards/: show.vue (scores, notes, media), new.vue (score inputs, media selector), public.vue (shareable view without auth). Include ScoreRing.vue component for visual gauges.

title: Create MontageGenerator service for progress timelines
description: Build app/services/montage_generator.rb to compile featured session_media into a timeline. Order by date, include captions. Return structured data for MediaMontage.vue component.

title: Create share dialog and media montage Vue components
description: Build components: ShareDialog.vue (generate/copy link, set expiry), MediaMontage.vue (timeline of progress photos with dates). Add share button to report_cards/show.vue.

title: Epic 8: Marketing Content Creation
description: Transform training media into marketing content. Platform-specific formatting (FB, IG, TikTok), client media permissions, and content scheduling.

title: Create MediaConsentsController for permission management
description: Implement MediaConsentsController to manage client permissions for using dog media in marketing. Track marketing_allowed, internal_only flags. Add consent UI to client detail page.

title: Create MarketingContentsController for content management
description: Implement MarketingContentsController with CRUD. Support status transitions: draft → scheduled → published. Filter media by consent status. Associate content with session_media items.

title: Create ContentFormatter service for platform optimization
description:
Build `app/services/content_formatter.rb` for platform-specific formatting.

**Image Dimensions** (use Active Storage variants):
- **Facebook**: 1200×630 (1.91:1 landscape)
- **Instagram Feed**: 1080×1080 (1:1 square)
- **Instagram Story/TikTok**: 1080×1920 (9:16 portrait)

**Text Limits:**
- **Facebook**: 2,000 chars (optimal: 80)
- **Instagram**: 2,200 chars (optimal: 150)
- **TikTok**: 2,200 chars (optimal: 100)

**Interface:**
```ruby
formatter = ContentFormatter.new(marketing_content)
formatter.for_platform(:instagram)
# => { image_url: "...", text: "truncated...", hashtags: [...] }
```

**Implementation notes:**
- Use Active Storage variants for image resizing
- Store platform-specific variants to avoid regenerating each time
- Include hashtag suggestions based on service type

title: Create marketing Vue pages with platform previews
description: Create pages/marketing/: index.vue (content calendar, status filters), new.vue (create from report card media), edit.vue (platform preview). Build components: PlatformPreview.vue, ContentScheduler.vue, ConsentBadge.vue.

title: Epic 3: Appointment Scheduling
description: Appointment CRUD with calendar views (month/week/day). Includes backend controller, calendar API endpoint, and Vue calendar component.

title: Create AppointmentsController with Inertia responses
description: Implement AppointmentsController with full CRUD. Include scopes: for_date_range, upcoming, by_status. Support filtering by client, dog, service_type, and date range.

title: Create calendar API endpoint for date range queries
description:
Create `Api::CalendarEventsController` at `app/controllers/api/calendar_events_controller.rb`:

**Route**: `GET /api/calendar_events?start=YYYY-MM-DD&end=YYYY-MM-DD`

**Response format** (compatible with FullCalendar):
```json
[
  {
    "id": 123,
    "title": "Private Training - Rex (Smith)",
    "start": "2025-12-10T09:00:00",
    "end": "2025-12-10T10:00:00",
    "color": "#22c55e",
    "extendedProps": { "status": "scheduled", "client_id": 1, "dog_id": 5 }
  }
]
```

**Status colors:**
- scheduled: #3b82f6 (blue)
- completed: #22c55e (green)
- cancelled: #ef4444 (red)
- no_show: #f59e0b (amber)

Accept start/end date params, return appointments within range as JSON events for calendar rendering.

title: Create AppointmentCalendar.vue component
description:
Build AppointmentCalendar.vue using a Vue-compatible calendar library.

**Recommended**: @fullcalendar/vue3 (https://fullcalendar.io/docs/vue) or vue-cal

**P1 Features (required):**
- Month/week/day view toggle
- Click appointment to open detail modal
- Click empty slot to open create form (pre-fill date/time)
- Fetch events from `/api/calendar_events` on view change

**P2 Features (implement after core functionality):**
- Drag-to-reschedule with PATCH to update appointment time

**Status color coding:** Use colors defined in calendar API task (sit-stay-g8j.2).

NOTE: shadcn Calendar is a date picker only, not suitable for full calendar views. Use FullCalendar or vue-cal instead.

title: Create appointment CRUD Vue pages
description: Create pages/appointments/: index.vue (calendar view), show.vue (details with linked report card), new.vue (booking form with service type selector, client/dog picker). Include AppointmentForm.vue and ServiceTypeSelector.vue components.

title: Epic 4: Group Classes & Recurring Appointments
description: Enrollment system for group classes with capacity limits and waitlists. Recurring appointment support with RRULE expansion.

title: Create EnrollmentsController for group class management
description: Implement EnrollmentsController for joining/leaving group classes. Handle capacity limits, waitlist additions, and cancellations. Nested under appointments.

title: Create WaitlistProcessor service for auto-promotion
description: Build app/services/waitlist_processor.rb to auto-promote waitlisted enrollments when spots open. Trigger on cancellation or capacity increase. Send notification to promoted clients.

title: Create RecurringAppointmentGenerator service
description:
Build `app/services/recurring_appointment_generator.rb` to expand RRULE patterns into appointment instances.

**Dependencies**: Add `ice_cube` gem for RRULE parsing and expansion

**Logic:**
1. Accept: start_date, end_date, recurrence_rule (RRULE string), appointment_template
2. Use IceCube to expand RRULE into occurrences within date range
3. Generate appointment instances with `series_id` pointing to the parent
4. Default expansion: Generate 3 months ahead, cap at 52 instances

**Interface:**
```ruby
generator = RecurringAppointmentGenerator.new(
  template: Appointment.find(123),
  recurrence: "FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO,WE",
  until_date: 3.months.from_now
)
generator.generate! # Creates appointment instances
generator.preview   # Returns dates without creating
```

Support daily, weekly, monthly recurrence patterns. Handle series_id for bulk edit/delete operations.

title: Create group class and recurrence Vue components
description: Build components: EnrollmentManager.vue (add/remove participants), WaitlistDisplay.vue (show position), RecurrenceSelector.vue (daily/weekly/monthly options). Enhance appointments/show.vue with enrollment list for groups.

title: Epic 5: Invoicing & Accounting
description: Invoice management with line items, status transitions (draft→sent→paid), and QuickBooks export capability.

title: Create InvoicesController with status transitions
description: Implement InvoicesController with full CRUD. Include member actions: send_to_client, mark_paid. Handle status transitions: draft → sent → paid/overdue. Calculate totals from line items.

title: Create invoice line items management
description: Implement nested InvoiceLineItemsController or handle via accepts_nested_attributes. Support dynamic add/remove of line items in invoice form. Auto-link appointments to line items.

title: Create invoice Vue pages with line item management
description: Create pages/invoices/: index.vue (filter by status, sort by date/amount), show.vue (line items, print view, payment actions), new.vue (dynamic line item management). Include InvoiceLineItemRow.vue and InvoiceStatusBadge.vue components.

title: Create QuickBooks export service
description:
Build `app/services/quickbooks_exporter.rb` for manual import to QuickBooks.

**Primary format**: CSV (IIF format is deprecated since 2016)

**CSV structure** (QuickBooks Online compatible):
```
InvoiceNo,Customer,InvoiceDate,DueDate,ItemDescription,ItemQuantity,ItemRate,ItemAmount
INV-001,John Smith,2025-12-01,2025-12-15,Private Training,2,75.00,150.00
```

**Features:**
- Export single invoice or date range batch
- Map Client to QuickBooks Customer name
- Handle multiple line items per invoice (one row per line item)
- Include invoice status in filename: `invoices_export_YYYYMMDD.csv`

**Controller integration**: Add `export` member action on InvoicesController that calls this service and returns the CSV as a download.

title: Epic 1: Data Layer Foundation
description: Create all database migrations, Rails models with validations/associations/scopes, and comprehensive seed data. This is the foundation that all other features depend on.

title: Create database migrations for all entities
description: Create migrations for: clients, dogs, service_types, appointments, enrollments, invoices, invoice_line_items, session_media, report_cards, media_consents, marketing_contents. Include proper indexes and foreign keys.

title: Create Rails models with validations and associations
description:
Create Rails models for all entities defined in migrations. For each model:
- **Validations**: Presence, format, and uniqueness as implied by schema constraints
- **Associations**: Define all foreign key relationships (belongs_to, has_many) per schema
- **Status enums**: Appointment (scheduled/completed/cancelled/no_show), Invoice (draft/sent/paid/overdue), Enrollment (active/waitlisted/cancelled), ReportCard (draft/published), MarketingContent (draft/scheduled/published)
- **Scopes**: At minimum, `active`, `recent`, and status-based scopes for each model with a status column

Models to create: Client, Dog, ServiceType, Appointment, Enrollment, Invoice, InvoiceLineItem, SessionMedia, ReportCard, MediaConsent, MarketingContent.

title: Create comprehensive seed data
description:
Create db/seeds.rb with realistic interconnected data:
- **Service Types**: "Private Training" ($75/hr), "Group Class" ($30/session, max_capacity: 6), "Board & Train" ($150/day)
- **Clients**: 5 clients with varied profiles (some with multiple dogs, some with single dog)
- **Dogs**: 10+ dogs distributed across clients (2-3 dogs for frequent clients, 1 for others)
- **Appointments**: 20 appointments spanning past 30 days to future 14 days, all statuses represented
- **Invoices**: 5 invoices (1 draft, 2 sent, 1 paid, 1 overdue) with realistic line items
- **Report Cards**: 10 report cards linked to completed appointments with varied scores (1-10)
- **Media Consents**: At least 3 clients with marketing_allowed: true for media management testing

Ensure all records are properly associated and form a coherent dataset for development testing.

title: Epic 6: Media Management
description: Active Storage setup for photo/video uploads during training sessions. Includes upload UI, gallery view, and background processing for thumbnails/transcoding.

title: Configure Active Storage for media uploads
description:
Configure Active Storage for session media uploads.

**Steps:**
1. Verify Active Storage tables exist, run `rails active_storage:install` if needed

2. **Storage configuration** (`config/storage.yml`):
   - local: Default for development
   - amazon: S3 config with environment variables (defer actual credentials to deployment)

3. **Model attachments:**
   ```ruby
   # Dog model
   has_one_attached :photo

   # SessionMedia model
   has_one_attached :file
   ```

4. **Validations** (use `activestorage-validator` gem or custom):
   - Images: jpg, png, webp; max 10MB
   - Videos: mp4, mov; max 100MB

5. **Variants** (define in model or concern):
   - :thumb → 200x200 crop
   - :medium → 800x800 limit
   - :large → 1600x1600 limit

title: Create SessionMediaController for upload and tagging
description: Implement SessionMediaController with create, update, destroy. Support direct upload from frontend. Handle tagging media to dogs and appointments. Mark media as featured.

title: Create media upload Vue components
description: Build components: MediaUploader.vue (drag-drop with progress), MediaGallery.vue (grid with lightbox), MediaTagger.vue (tag to dog, mark featured). Integrate upload into appointments/show.vue.

title: Create ProcessMediaJob for thumbnails and transcoding
description:
Build `app/jobs/process_media_job.rb` for background media processing using Solid Queue.

**Trigger:** After SessionMedia record created (use `after_create_commit` callback)

**P1 - Image Processing (required):**
- Generate variants (thumb, medium, large) using vips (faster than ImageMagick)
- Variants are lazy-generated by Active Storage, but pre-warm thumb variant for better UX

**P2 - Video Processing (defer if time-constrained):**
- Transcode to H.264 MP4 using ffmpeg
- Extract thumbnail frame for preview
- Consider third-party service (Mux, Cloudinary) for production

**Implementation:**
```ruby
class ProcessMediaJob < ApplicationJob
  queue_as :default
  
  def perform(session_media_id)
    media = SessionMedia.find(session_media_id)
    return unless media.file.attached?
    
    if media.file.image?
      media.file.variant(:thumb).processed
    elsif media.file.video?
      # P2: Video processing
    end
  end
end
```
